SEARCH
Package tetris.boards.physics

Class PlayerInputHandler

java.lang.Object
tetris.boards.physics.PlayerInputHandler
public class PlayerInputHandler extends Object
Handles processing of raw keyboard input and applying it to the game state.

This class implements standard Tetris control mechanics, specifically:

  • DAS (Delayed Auto Shift): The initial delay before a held key starts repeating.
  • ARR (Automatic Repeat Rate): The speed at which the movement repeats after DAS kicks in.
It buffers inputs to ensure responsive movement and prevents conflicting actions (like moving left and right simultaneously).

  • Field Details

    • AUTOMATIC_REPEAT_RATE_FRAMES

      public static final int AUTOMATIC_REPEAT_RATE_FRAMES
      Automatic Repeat Rate: How many frames between movement repeats. Calculated to be approx 30hz (every 2 frames at 60fps).
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • DELAYED_AUTO_SHIFT_FRAMES

      public static final int DELAYED_AUTO_SHIFT_FRAMES
      Delayed Auto Shift: How many frames a key must be held before auto-repeat begins. Calculated to be approx 6hz (wait ~10 frames at 60fps).
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

  • Constructor Details

    • PlayerInputHandler

      public PlayerInputHandler(BoardGrid grid, RotationSystem rotationSystem, Gravity gravity)
      Creates a new Input Handler.
      Parameters:
      grid - The board grid for collision checking during movement.
      rotationSystem - The system to use for calculating rotations (e.g., SRS, NES).
      gravity - The gravity engine to trigger drops.

  • Method Details

    • setFallingTetromino

      public void setFallingTetromino(Tetromino fallingTetromino)
      Sets the active tetromino that will respond to player commands.
      Parameters:
      fallingTetromino - The currently falling piece.

    • update

      public void update()
      Processes input states and updates the tetromino's position or orientation.

      This method should be called exactly once per game frame. It handles: 1. Hard Drop (Instant) 2. Left/Right Movement (DAS/ARR logic) 3. Soft Drop 4. Rotations

    • moveLeftPressed

      public void moveLeftPressed()
      Call when Move Left key is pressed. Initializes the counter to 0 to trigger immediate movement.

    • moveLeftReleased

      public void moveLeftReleased()
      Call when Move Left key is released. Resets counter to -1.

    • moveRightPressed

      public void moveRightPressed()
